_header: I am elder than I was of winter and of lore

BodDig4.First Lines:
Ic am elder þanne ic wesa wintre & ec a loreic ealdi
                    more þanne ic dedemi wit oȝhte to bi more…
BodDig4.Last Lines:
…Crist ȝeue us lede swich lif& habbe swichne
                    endeþet we moten þider cumenwanne we henned
                    wende
BodDig4.Editions:
Hickes,  George. 
             Linguarum Veterum Septentrionalium Thesaurus Grammatico-Criticus et
                Archaeologicus.
         Oxford, 1705: 1.222.
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             “Zum poema morale.” 
             Anglia
         1 (1878): 5-37: 5-32.
Lewin,  Hermann. 
             Das mittelenglische Poema Morale im kritischen text.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1881. 
Marcus,  Hans,
                        ed.  
             Das frühmittelenglische Poema Morale.
Palaestra
          194. Leipzig, 1934.

OxfJesus29.First Lines:
Ich am eldre þan ich wes a winter and ek on loreIch welde more
                    þan ich dude my wyt auhte beo more…
OxfJesus29.Last Lines:
…Bidde nu we leoue freond yonge and ek oldeÞat he
                    þat þis wryt wrot his saule beo þer ac holde

Morris,  Richard,  and  Walter William Skeat, eds.

            Oxford: Clarendon, 1872, 2nd ed. 1894; Pt. III. Orig. published separately,
            1871: 1.196 ff..

                        ed.  
             An Old English Miscellany: A Bestiary, Kentish Sermons, Proverbs of

EETS
         o.s. 49 (1872); repr. 1988: 58-71.
Lewin,  Hermann. 
             Das mittelenglische Poema Morale im kritischen text.
         Halle: Niemeyer, 1881.

CamFitzMc123.First Lines:
Ich am elder þane ich was of wintre & of loreIch eldi more
                    þane ich dude mi wit aȝte beo þe more…
CamFitzMc123.Last Lines:
…Crist us leue lede suich lif & habbe suicchne
                    endeÞat we mote to him come whane we henne wende
CamFitzMc123.Note:
With verse couplet heading, ‘Þe holi gostes miȝte us
                    alle helpe & diȝte us wissie & us teche / Y scilde us fram þe
                    miþiȝte bi daie & bi niȝte þat þencheþ us
                    bireche’.
CamFitzMc123.Editions:
Paues,  Anna C. 
             “A Newly Discovered Manuscript of the Poema Morale.” 
             Anglia
         30 (1907): 217-37: 227-37.

CamTCC335.First Lines:
Ich am nu elder þan ich was awintre & abreIch wealde more
                    þan idude mi wit oh to be more…
CamTCC335.Last Lines:
…rest geue us laden her swilch lif & habben her swilch
                    endeþat we moren þider cume þane we henne wende
                    Amen

BLEge613.First Lines:
I eam elder þen ic ƿas aƿintre and a loreIc waeld
                    more þanne ic dude mi ƿit ah to ben more…
BLEge613.Last Lines:
…Þer is ƿele abute gane & reste abuten
                    swincheÞe mai and nele ðider comesare hit him scal of
                    ðinche
BLEge613.Editions:
Zupitza,  Julius. 
             Alt- und mittelenglisches Uebungsbuch mit einem
                Wörterbuch.
         8th ed. Vienna and Leipzig: Braumüller, 1907; 12th ed., ed. Albert
            Eichler. Wein: Braumüller, 1922: 81-91.

Lam487.First Lines:
ich em nu alder þane ich ƿesa ƿintre and a
                    lare…
Lam487.Last Lines:
…Þa boð nu mid him in hellefordon and
                    fordemet
Lam487.Note: Lines 1-270. Written as prose. First lines in rubric.
